comments.body: makes me wonder whether the global default should be the test endpoint or prod.
From my other PR I clearly had assumed that the default was prod. But the test endpoint makes sense in terms of less configuration since the vast majority of our tests use that endpoint.
yeah, the default used to be prod. I guess as long as we've audited all places we expected this to be prod, we're probably OK.
It's just these two. And I double-checked that the two staging tests were set correctly as well.

comments.body: Since each of these is running in a separate project, please don't use `E2E_NAME`, and let it default.
The default value of `E2E_NAME` won't have the `-trusty` suffix, which is required to start a GKE cluster with Trusty images. @roberthbailey can give the context.
Please add an explanation comment.
Done.

Same for other jobs.

comments.body: Is this the right project?

Yeah it has quota. I'd create a new one but then have to wait till quota is granted etc, so I just put the todo and FAIL_ON_GCP_RESOURCE_LEAK=false (the test will fail if there's a leak based on internal checks anyway)
Also this project has the gke side flag we need to flip with an internal cl each time a new e2e gke project is created

comments.body:
putting this in 'provider-env' seems somewhat arbitrary, but I guess there's no better place?

seems like we may want to have this version as another option for projects? can default to 'ci/latest', but override to 'ci/latest-1.2' here, 'ci/latest-1.1' for 1.1 builds, etc?

Yes, I want to wait until we've got the 1.2 jobs in then do a big YAML cleanup. We can start doing things like putting `export JENKINS_PUBLISHED_VERSION="{published-version}"` in the build script along with a global default to `ci/latest` and stuff. It'll be nice.
should we also set `branch`, even though it's not used by e2e jobs as best I can tell?
No, I should remove the branch variable from the others. It used to be used to call the runner for that branch, back when they were all `e2e.sh`.
